text: @ggreenwald @JackForIowa @CarlBeijer Who controls state houses, Glenn? Govs? For decades into the future thanks to gerrymandering. Even in purple states. Are you really under the delusion that the GOP isn't the dominant political force today? Are you that distracted by the presidency and a 50-50 Senate?

@vernors_is_bae @JackForIowa @CarlBeijer The Democrats control the House, the Senate and the White House. I know that it feels good to pretend that your political enemies are the ones with all the power and you have none, but Dems have exerted large amounts of political control over many decades.

@ggreenwald @JackForIowa @CarlBeijer So now "discourse" by a mere "faction" is tyranny? Completely unhinged. The GOP dominates most politics in the USA, destroying workers power, the environment, and minority rights. And you're concerned about.... what exactly? Dumb cancel culture/IDpol stuff? Get real.

@JackForIowa @vernors_is_bae @CarlBeijer The faction of left-wing discourse driven by the emotionally and intellectually stunted game that has one rule -- try to pin racist/bigoted innuendo on whoever you're arguing with -- bores me. Just don't give a shit. I don't think people's lives should be dictated by your values.
@ggreenwald @vernors_is_bae @CarlBeijer What “values and way of life” is that Glenn? You’re using direct word for word defenses of Jim Crow laws, anti-gay marriage laws, anti-abortion laws, etc.

@vernors_is_bae @CarlBeijer I explained this. It's not designed to make sure they have more than you. It'd designed to ensure that large states can't run roughshod over the values and way of life of people in smaller states, and it was a condition for them joining the union for that reason.

@ggreenwald @CarlBeijer Honestly shocked and disappointed that you think a rancher in WY should have more political power at the voting booth than I do. Yes, this is what you expressed to Beck. Why are only rural constituencies worth propping up with a disproportionate Senate?

@CarlBeijer The Chomsky clip is about restriction of voting rights, not equal representation of smaller states in the Senate. Implying that that's the same as advocating for limiting the right to vote based on race, gender and land ownership - as if I did that - is just drearily dishonest.
